prompt: <description>**Instructions for part 1** *Shape*: A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. *Step 1*: Create a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.7143]. *Step 2*: Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. *Step 3*: The sketch contains one face (face\\_1) and one loop (loop\\_1). The loop consists of four lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, line\\_4) which form a rectangle. *Step 4*: Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.7143. *Step 5*: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. *Step 6*: Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.0357 units to create the 3D model. **Instructions for part 2** *Shape*: A CAD model of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole through its center. The prism has a flat top and bottom, and the cylindrical hole is centered along the length of the prism. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 10 units long, 5 units wide, and 3 units tall. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of about 2 units. *Step 1*: Create a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.7143, 0.0, 0.0]. *Step 2*: Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. *Step 3*: The sketch contains two faces (face\\_1, face\\_2) and one loop each (loop\\_1). Face 1 loop consists of four lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, line\\_4) which form a rectangle, and face 2 loop consists of four lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, line\\_4) which form a rectangle. *Step 4*: Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.7143. *Step 5*: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. *Step 6*: Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis. The top of the prism should have an extrusion depth of 0.0 towards the normal, and the bottom of the prism should have an extrusion depth of 0.0357 opposite the normal. **Instructions for part 3** *Shape*: A CAD model of a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. *Step 1*: Create a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to [90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.7143, 0.0]. *Step 2*: Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. *Step 3*: The sketch contains two faces (face\\_1, face\\_2) and one loop each (loop\\_1). Face 1 loop consists of four lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, line\\_4) which form a rectangle, and face 2 loop consists of four lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, line\\_4) which form a rectangle. *Step 4*: Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.7143. *Step 5*: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. *Step 6*: Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis. The top of the prism should have an extrusion depth of 0.0 towards the normal, and the bottom of the prism should have an extrusion depth of 0.0357 opposite the normal. **Note**: The final model is a combination of the three parts. Use the appropriate boolean operations to combine the parts based on their shapes and orientations.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: X=0°, Y=0°, Z=-90° * Translation Vector: (0, 0.015, 0) Sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Create the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler Angles to (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and the Translation Vector to (0.0, 0.0243, 0.0). This will define the orientation and position of the 2D sketch plane. Draw the 2D sketch Next, create a new sketch on the 2D sketch plane defined by the coordinate system. Face 1 Create a loop, named loop\\_1, on the sketch plane, and add four lines to it: 1. line\\_1: Connect the points (0.0, 0.0) and (0.4633, 0.0). 2. line\\_2: Connect the points (0.4633, 0.0) and (0.4633, 0.75). 3. line\\_3: Connect the points (0.4633, 0.75) and (0.0, 0.75). 4. line\\_4: Connect the points (0.0, 0.75) and (0.0, 0.0). This loop, loop\\_1, is the outline of the rectangular prism. Loop 2 (Circular Cutout 1) Create a new loop, named loop\\_2, and add a circle to it using the circle tool. Set the circle's center to (0.128, 0.128) and its radius to 0.0621. This will create the first circular cutout of the rectangular prism. Loop 3 (Circular Cutout 2) Create a new loop, named loop\\_3, and draw a rectangle on the sketch plane with the following four points: (0.1837, 0.2944), (0.2797, 0.2944), (0.2797, 0.4185), and (0.1837, 0.4185). Divide this rectangle into four lines as described and add them to this loop. This loop, loop\\_3, is the outline of the second circular cutout. Loop 4 (Circular Cutout 3) Create a new loop, named loop\\_4, and add a circle to it using the circle tool. Set the circle's center to (0.3353, 0.128) and its radius to 0.0621. This will create the third circular cutout of the rectangular prism. Extrude the 2D sketch to prepare the 3D model After creating the loops and circles, extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Set the extrusion's extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal to 0.0243, and leave the extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal at 0.0. Set the sketch\\_scale parameter to 0.75. The part will be created as a new body, so set the operation to "NewBodyFeatureOperation". Once completed, you will have created a 3D model of a rectangular prism with three circular cutouts on its surface. The cutouts are evenly spaced and aligned with the edges of the prism, and the prism is centered on a white background as described in the final shape documentation. The dimensions of the final shape are as follows: * length: 0.75 (including circular cutouts) * width: 0.0243 (maximum width between circular cutouts) * height: 0.75</description>

prompt: <description>**Instructions for part 1** Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom. The cylinder has a slightly tapered shape, narrowing slightly towards the bottom. The top and bottom edges are sharp and straight. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Sketch the 2D profile for the cylindrical object on face 1 of the coordinate system. Create one loop with one circle. The circle should have a center at 0.375, 0.375 and a radius of 0.375. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal direction by a depth of 0.5625 units and along the opposite normal direction by 0 units. **Instructions for part 2** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.1251, 0.1251, 0.5625. Sketch the 2D profile for the cylindrical object on face 1 of the coordinate system. Create one loop with one circle. The circle should have a center at 0.2499, 0.2499 and a radius of 0.2499. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.4997. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal direction by a depth of 0.0 units and along the opposite normal direction by 0.375 units. This will cut the previously created part. The height of part 1 is 0.5625 units, the width is 0.75 units and the length is also 0.75 units. The height of part 2 is 0.375 units, the width is 0.4997 units and the length is 0.4997 units. The final CAD model is a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, where the height of the cylinder is approximately twice the diameter. The object is centered in the image.</description>
